intro: Thoa parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved thoa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Thoa parvifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
